result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Colleen Marie Hastings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Colleen Marie Hastings is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Colleen Marie Hastings was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Colleen Marie Hastings was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Penalty When None Expressed-Misdemeanor], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
Count 5 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Probation may be transferred to Polk County.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 31, 2016.
Court notes 117 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

per Defendant's bond. eif
Count 5 - all parties signed this date. c: DA. eif
filed by ADA Edward Minser. eif

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Issac S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Colleen Marie Hastings appeared.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  State files an amended Information with the Court.  State files a Diversion Agreement for Ct. 5.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 5, Ct. 11 & Ct. 12 .  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 11 & Ct 12 & stays the adjudication on Ct. 5 pending the full performance of the Diversion Agreement. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2,  Ct. 3 & Ct. 9. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 11 & Ct. 12 are to run concurrent
- W/S 2 years probation with conditions
- Probation can be transfered to Polk County
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Issac Smak.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Credit for 117 days if revoked
- DE to report to probation today 03/31/16
- Court costs of $886 to be paid through the DOC
- 20 days to appeal

Court reviews the Diversion Agreement with the DE
- Court will accept the Diversion Agreement and signs the order
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.

The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
